Second and third stage of labour 
• S
pontaneous delivery is usually preferable to Caesarean delivery, unless there are obstetric reasons for surgery.
• A void  the lithotomy position: the mother must remain upright or semi-upright when delivering, with her legs
supported by two assistants below the level of her chest.
• Once the fetal head has engaged and the mother is bearing down, perform instrumental delivery unless delivery
is rapid and easy.
